result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur J Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------
  **NOTE:  Defendant's attorney was court appointed and a wage assignment was put into effect and shall continue in effect until the Clerk of Courts Office is reimbursed in full for attorney's fees and costs.
-----------------------------

with Huber privileges to commence on or before January 2, 2015 @ 8:00 am.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.
-----------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Arthur J Olson appeared, Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Motion for Appointment of COunsel Granted.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND: 14CF146 (14GF301), 14CT95 AND 14CT96.  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.N. (4/14/99); H.J. (5/15/98)' H.M. (2/2/2000) OR S.K. OR THEIR RESIDENCES.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendnat appears in court. Dan Necci appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
